question: Which of the following promulgated Mahzar, through which the King delegated to himself the powers to interpret various Islamic norms?
explanation: The Mughl emperor Akbar promulgated Mahzar, through which he delegated to himself the powers to interpret various Islamic norms, which had so far been the ulema's predecessors. Akbar also initiated various experiments like the Sulh-i-Kul and Din-i-lIIahi.
